title: It seems nobody knows how Ultimate Hat works.
body:
So I've noticed a trend in people saying that with Ultimate Hat at max stacks and 40% CDR, a champion's ult already goes down to 45% its original cooldown.

This is not how Ultimate Hat works.  It reduces the base cooldown by up to 15%, meaning it will take a 100 cooldown ultimate down to 85 seconds, same as other CDR.  The difference is when regular CDR is added to this.  Regular CDR acts on the cooldown after it has been reduced by Ultimate Hat.

So with that example of the 100 second base cooldown ult, It drops down to 85 seconds with Ultimate Hat.  With 40% CDR, it becomes 60 seconds.  With both Ultimate Hat and 40% CDR, the cooldown drops to 51 seconds rather than the 45 seconds that people think it would reach.

This isn't an incredible deal, but I've been noticing this a lot today, and thought people may want to know.

replies.body:
Or just say it stacks multiplicatively, not additively.

100 seconds x 15%CDR x 40%CDR = 100 x (1-0.4) x (1-0.15) = 100 x 0.6 x 0.85 = 51 seconds

TL;DR

Ultimate Hat is most effective on champs that need their ult up, but don't want to buy CDR.
Idk why people are downvoting you, this is actually how it works

CDR is actually stronger the more of it you have. The way they've designed it is that it combining it with CDR doesn't make it exponentially more powerful.

It gives you 15% more ult uptime than if you didn't have it whether you've bought 0% CDR or 40%. Whereas getting 10% CDR when you already have 30% is a massive effective uptime boost compared to getting it when you have 0% CDR.

Also, not buying CDR on your champion means it will potentially take longer to stack Ultimate Hat.

Ultimate hat does do this, but I don't know why people think that it's bad. Sure, with a 100 second CD ult that has nothing else affecting it, you get 15 seconds off, then with 45% CDR that goes to around 46 seconds. That's a big difference from 85 seconds no matter how you look at it. I love Ultimate Hat on Evelynn and Katarina, and of course champions who also have ways to lower CDs on their ultimates because it works very well with them(I know Evelynn doesn't have this, just saying it's good on those champions). Saying it's a terrible choice is silly when I can get my ult on Katarina down to 24 seconds without a kill(because I usually get at least 10% CDR), reduced to 9 seconds with one kill, adding Presence of Mind from PBE into the mix that's 7 seconds with one kill,  and back up with 2 kills either way. Having your ult up a lot is a playstyle decision, and is useful especially on champions who have ways to lower their ultimate CD, or really NEED their ultimate to have an impact. 15 seconds off a 100 second ultimate is really good, even if you don't think it is.
